edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.coinTossing
Class CTSemiSimulatablePartyOne

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.coinTossing.CTSemiSimulatablePartyOne
All Implemented Interfaces:
CTPartyOne, OneSidedSimulation, ProtocolSecLevel, SecurityLevel
public class CTSemiSimulatablePartyOne
extends java.lang.Object
implements CTPartyOne, OneSidedSimulation

This class plays as party one of coin tossing protocol which tosses a string.

This protocol is fully secure (with simulation) when P1 is corrupted and fulfills a definition of “pseudorandomness” when P2 is corrupted.

This protocol uses any perfectly-hiding commitment scheme (e.g., COMMIT_PEDERSEN, COMMIT_HASH_PEDERSEN, COMMIT_HASH) and any perfectly-binding commitment scheme (e.g., COMMIT_ELGAMAL).

The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 6.3 of pseudo codes document at http://crypto.biu.ac.il/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode_SCAPI_V2.0.0.pdf.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

Constructor Summary
CTSemiSimulatablePartyOne(CmtCommitter committer, CmtReceiver receiver, int l, java.security.SecureRandom random)
          Constructor that sets the given committer and receiver.
 
Method Summary
 CTOutput toss()
          Runs the following protocol: "SAMPLE a random L-bit string s1 <- {0,1}^L RUN the committer in subprotocol COMMIT_PERFECT_HIDING.commit on s1 RUN the receiver in subprotocol COMMIT_PERFECT_BINDING.commit RUN the committer in subprotocol COMMIT_PERFECT_HIDING.decommit to reveal s1 RUN the receiver in subprotocol COMMIT_PERFECT_BINDING.decommit to receive s2 OUTPUT s1 XOR s2"

Method Detail

toss

public CTOutput toss()
              throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                     java.io.IOException,
                     CommitValueException,
                     CheatAttemptException
Runs the following protocol:

"SAMPLE a random L-bit string s1 <- {0,1}^L

RUN the committer in subprotocol COMMIT_PERFECT_HIDING.commit on s1

RUN the receiver in subprotocol COMMIT_PERFECT_BINDING.commit

RUN the committer in subprotocol COMMIT_PERFECT_HIDING.decommit to reveal s1

RUN the receiver in subprotocol COMMIT_PERFECT_BINDING.decommit to receive s2

OUTPUT s1 XOR s2"

Specified by:
toss in interface CTPartyOne
Returns:
CTOutput contains the tossed "coin".
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there was a problem in the serialization mechanism
java.io.IOException - can occur in the commit phase.
CommitValueException - can occur in case the protocol uses an ElGamal committer.
CheatAttemptException - if party one suspects that party two is trying to cheat.
